page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Hefferston Grange}is the oldest site, apart from the Church,in Weaverham .It is thought to be the Hall mentioned in Domesday Book.Now it is a largely derelict Georgian Building whose grounds are used as an old peoples hospital.It has an old ice-house and Adams ceilings in some rooms. On West Road there is a small{cottage once thatched which may be as old as {13th c.}Another old building is{Poplar {Cottages}which is just being done up. This makes the main street very narrow and dangerous. {Weaverham Grammar School}is now a private house,but it was run in the 19th c. by the Parish Church.It too is a very old building. Most of the rest of old Weaverham is Georgian with some Victorian cottages.
